text: However, while this may emphasize the fact that giving to people who can help you the most now may be a better selfish strategy in the short term, I argue that giving to those in need goes significantly further than giving to those who already have much, and that reciprocity will be much greater from those in need when they are more fortunate than those for whom your generosity meant less.

text: Jetten and Peters focus on subjective experience and more subtle forms of inequality, especially in education, to show how deeply entrenched social inequalities can have an adverse effect on students in universities and the education system, despite there being no obvious inequality in their education.
